post.excerpt: 本篇笔记介绍了集合的基本概念，包括集合的定义、表示方法、集合之间的关系、集合的操作以及函数的基本性质。我们探讨了集合的基数、可数性以及康托定理等重要主题。通过这些内容，读者将能够理解离散数学中集合和函数的基本结构和性质。（由 gpt-4o-mini 生成摘要）
post.html:
本篇笔记介绍了集合的基本概念，包括集合的定义、表示方法、集合之间的关系、集合的操作以及函数的基本性质。我们探讨了集合的基数、可数性以及康托定理等重要主题。通过这些内容，读者将能够理解离散数学中集合和函数的基本结构和性质。（由 gpt-4o-mini 生成摘要）

Word Table

  • 符号(notation)
  • 省略号(ellipse)
  • 括号(brace)

1. 集合 Sets

1.1. 引言 Introduction

集合(set)：A set is an unordered collection of objects.

  • The objects in a set are call the 元素(elements)，or members, of the set.
  • A set is said to 包含(contain) its elements.
    • a∈Aa \in Aa∈A：aaa is the member of the set AAA.
    • a∉Aa \not\in Aa∈A：aaa is not the member of the set AAA.
  • 空集(empty set)：∅\varnothing∅.

集合的表示方式：The descriptions of a set

  • Roster method: listing all its members between braces, e.g. S={1,3,5,7,9}S=\{1,3,5,7,9\}S={1,3,5,7,9}.
  • Brace notation with ellipses: e.g. S={1,2,…,99}S=\{1,2,\ldots,99\}S={1,2,…,99}.
  • Specification using set builder: S={x∣P(x)}S=\{x\mid P(x)\}S={x∣P(x)}, which means SSS contains all the elements from UUU (全集(universal set)) which have the property PPP.
  • 维恩图(Venn diagrams)

罗素悖论 Russell Paradox

Suppose there is a town with just one male barber; and that every man in the town keeps himself clean-shaven: some by shaving themselves, some by attending the barber. The barber obeys the following rule: he shaves all and only those men in town who do not shave themselves. Does the barber shave himself?

1.2. 集合之间的关系 Relations between Sets

1.2.1. Subset

A⊆BA\subseteq BA⊆B: AAA is a 子集(subset) of the set BBB.

A⊆B⇔∀x(x∈A→x∈B)A \subseteq B \Leftrightarrow \forall x (x \in A \rightarrow x \in B)A⊆B⇔∀x(x∈A→x∈B)

1.2.2. Equal

A=BA=BA=B: AAA is 等于(equal) to BBB.

A=B⇔A⊆B∧B⊆AA=B \Leftrightarrow A \subseteq B \land B \subseteq AA=B⇔A⊆B∧B⊆A

1.2.3. Proper Subset

A⊂BA\subset BA⊂B: A is a 真子集(proper subset) of the set BBB.

A⊂B⇔A⊆B∧A≠B⇔∀x(x∈A→x∈B)∧∃(x∈B∧x∉A)A \subset B \Leftrightarrow A \subseteq B \land A \neq B \Leftrightarrow \forall x (x \in A \rightarrow x \in B) \land \exists (x \in B \land x\not\in A)A⊂B⇔A⊆B∧A=B⇔∀x(x∈A→x∈B)∧∃(x∈B∧x∈A)

1.2.4. The Size of Sets

Let SSS be a set. If there are exactly nnn distinct elements in SSS where nnn is a nonnegative integer, we say that SSS is a 有限集(finite set) and that nnn is the cardinality of SSS.

1.2.5. Power Sets

Given a set S, the 幂集(power set) of S is the set of all subsets of the set S. P(x)\mathcal{P}(x)P(x) denotes the power set of SSS.

证明：P(A)∈P(B)⇒A∈B\mathcal{P}(A) \in \mathcal{P}(B) \Rightarrow A\in BP(A)∈P(B)⇒A∈B.

1.2.6. Cartesian Products

The 有序 nnn 元组(ordered nnn-tuple) (a1,a2,⋯ ,an)(a_1,a_2,\cdots ,a_n)(a1​,a2​,⋯,an​) is the ordered collection that has a1a_1a1​ as its first element, a2a_2a2​ as its second element, … , and ana_nan​ as its nth element.

A1,A2,⋯ ,AnA_1,A_2,\cdots,A_nA1​,A2​,⋯,An​ 的卡特兰积(cartesian product) 定义为

A1×A2×⋯An={(a1,a2,⋯ ,an)∣ai∈Aifor i=1,2,⋯n}A_1 \times A_2 \times \cdots A_n = \{(a_1,a_2,\cdots,a_n) \mid a_i \in A_i \quad\text{for }i=1,2,\cdots n\}A1​×A2​×⋯An​={(a1​,a2​,⋯,an​)∣ai​∈Ai​for i=1,2,⋯n}
  • If ∣A∣=m, ∣B∣=n|A|=m,\ |B|=n∣A∣=m, ∣B∣=n, then ∣A×B∣=∣B×A∣=mn|A\times B|=|B\times A|=mn∣A×B∣=∣B×A∣=mn.
  • A×B≠B×AA\times B\neq B\times AA×B=B×A
  • A×∅=∅×A=∅A\times \varnothing = \varnothing \times A= \varnothingA×∅=∅×A=∅

1.2.7. Truth Sets of Quantifiers

Given a predicate PPP and a domain DDD. The 真集(truth set) of PPP is PPP is the set of elements xxx in DDD for which P(x)P(x)P(x) is true. Namely, the power set of PPP is {x∈D∣P(x)}\{x \in D\mid P(x)\}{x∈D∣P(x)}

1.3. 集合操作 Set Operations

1.3.1. Union

A∪B={x∣x∈A∨x∈B}A\cup B = \{x \mid x \in A \lor x \in B\}A∪B={x∣x∈A∨x∈B}

1.3.2. Intersection

A∩B={x∣x∈A∧x∈B}A\cap B = \{x \mid x \in A \land x\in B\}A∩B={x∣x∈A∧x∈B}

1.3.3. Difference

A−B={x∣x∈A∧x∉B}A-B = \{x \mid x\in A \land x \not\in B\}A−B={x∣x∈A∧x∈B}: The difference of AAA and BBB.

1.3.4. Complement

A‾={x∣x∉A∧x∈U}\overline{A} = \{x \mid x \not\in A \land x\in U\}A={x∣x∈A∧x∈U}: A‾\overline{A}A is the 补集(complement) of the set AAA.

1.3.5. Symmetric difference

A⊕B=(A∪B)−(A∩B)A\oplus B = (A\cup B) - (A\cap B)A⊕B=(A∪B)−(A∩B)

按出现与否统计的话就类似于异或操作。

1.4. 集合恒等式 Set Indentities

更多集合恒等式(set indentities) 可以参考逻辑恒等式。

证明集合相等的一些方法 Ways to Prove Set Identities

  • 将证明恒等式转化为证两次子集。Show that A⊆BA\subseteq BA⊆B and that B⊆AB\subseteq AB⊆A.
  • 转化为 set builder 的形式，然后用逻辑恒等式证明。Use logical equivalences to prove equivalent set definitions.
  • 类似于真值表的做法。Use a membership table.
  • 从已有的恒等式中推演。Use previously proven identities.

2. 函数 Functions

2.1. 引言 Introduction

Let AAA and BBB be nonempty sets. A 函数(function) (mapping or transformations) fff from AAA to BBB:

f:A→Bf:A\rightarrow Bf:A→B
∀a(a∈A→∃!b(b∈B∧f(a)=b))\forall a (a \in A \rightarrow \exists ! b (b \in B \land f(a) = b))∀a(a∈A→∃!b(b∈B∧f(a)=b))
  • AAA is called the 定义域(domain) of fff
  • BBB is called the 值域(codomain) of fff

If f(a)=bf(a) = bf(a)=b,

  • bbb is called the image of aaa under fff.
  • aaa is called a preimage of bbb.

Let fff be a function from the set AAA to the set BBB. The 图(graph) of the function fff is the set of ordered pairs

{(a,b)∣a∈A∧f(a)=b}\{(a,b) \mid a \in A \land f(a) = b\}{(a,b)∣a∈A∧f(a)=b}

2.2. 单射与满射 One-to-One and Onto Functions

A function f is 单射函数(one-to-one function = injection) (denoted 1-1), or 单射的(injective) if

∀a∀b(f(a)=f(b)→a=b)\forall a \forall b (f(a) = f(b) \rightarrow a = b)∀a∀b(f(a)=f(b)→a=b)

A function fff from AAA to BBB is called 满射函数(onto function = surjection), or 满射的(surjective) if

∀b∈B∃a∈A(f(a)=b)\forall b \in B \exists a \in A (f(a) = b)∀b∈B∃a∈A(f(a)=b)

The function f is a 一一对应的(one-to-one correspondence), or a 双射(bijection), if it is both one-to-one and onto.

Showing that fff is one-to-one or onto

2.3. 反函数 Inverse Functions

Let fff be a bijection from AAA to BBB. Then the 反函数(inverse function) of fff, denoted as f−1f^{-1}f−1, is the function from BBB to AAA defined as

f−1(y)=x iff f(x)=yf^{-1} (y) = x \text{ iff } f(x) = yf−1(y)=x iff f(x)=y
  • 函数 fff 的反函数存在当且仅当函数 fff 是双射函数。Function fff is 可逆的(invertible) if and only if fff is bijective. No inverse function exists unless fff is a bijection.

2.4. 函数的复合 Compositions of Functions

Let ggg be a function from the set AAA to the set BBB and let fff be a function form the set BBB to the set CCC. The composition of the functions fff and ggg denoted by f∘gf \circ gf∘g is defined by:

f∘g(a)=f(g(a))f \circ g (a) = f(g(a))f∘g(a)=f(g(a))
  • f∘gf\circ gf∘g can’t be defined unless the range of ggg is a subset of the domain of fff.

2.5. 高斯函数 Floor and Ceiling Functions

关于高斯函数的实用性质 Useful Properties of the Floor and Ceiling Functions

3. 数列 Sequence

3.1. 引言 Introduction

A 数列(sequence) is a function from a subset of the set of integers (usually either the set {0,1,2,…}\{0, 1, 2, \ldots\}{0,1,2,…} or the set {1,2,3,…}\{1, 2, 3,\ldots\}{1,2,3,…}) to a set SSS. We use the notation ana_nan​ to denote the image of the integer nnn. We call an a term of the sequence.

A 等比数列(geometric progression) is a sequence of the form

a, ar, ar2, …, arna,\ ar,\ ar^2,\ \ldots,\ ar^na, ar, ar2, …, arn

where the initial term aaa and the 公比(common ratio) rrr are real numbers.

An 等差数列(arithmetic progression) is a sequence of the form

a, a+d, a+2d …, a+nda,\ a+d,\ a+2d\, \ldots,\ a+nda, a+d, a+2d…, a+nd

where the initial term aaa and the 公差(common difference) ddd are real numbers.

3.2. 和式 Summations

∑s∈Sf(s)\sum_{s\in S} f(s)s∈S∑​f(s)

SSS: the subset of the domain of the function fff

Some Useful Summation Formulae

4. 集合的基数 Cardinality of Sets

4.1. 引言 Introduction

  • The cardinality of a set AAA is equal to the cardinality of a set BBB, denoted ∣A∣=∣B∣| A | = | B |∣A∣=∣B∣, iff there exists a bijection from AAA to BBB.
  • If there is an injection from AAA to BBB, the cardinality of AAA is less than or the same as the cardinality of BBB and we write ∣A∣≤∣B∣|A| \le |B|∣A∣≤∣B∣. When ∣A∣≤∣B∣|A| \le |B|∣A∣≤∣B∣ and AAA and BBB have different cardinality, we say that the cardinality of AAA is less than the cardinality of BBB and write ∣A∣<∣B∣|A|<|B|∣A∣<∣B∣.

所以说，比较集合的基数(cardinality of set) 的大小最关键的步骤就在于找到一个集合 SSS 到另一个集合 TTT 的单射，如果这样的单射能够找到，就有 ∣S∣≤∣T∣|S|\le |T|∣S∣≤∣T∣。

4.2. 可数的 Countable

  • A set that is either 有限的(finite) or has the same cardinality as the set of positive integers called 可数的(countable).
  • A set that is not countable is called 不可数的(uncountable).
  • When an infinite set SSS is countable, we denote the cardinality of SSS by ℵ0\aleph_0ℵ0​ (阿列夫零(aleph null)).
  • If ∣A∣=∣Z+∣|A| = | \mathbb{Z}_+ |∣A∣=∣Z+​∣, the set AAA is 可数无穷(countable infinite).

证明：正有理数集 Q+\mathbb{Q}_+Q+​ 是可数的。

(1) ∣Q+∣≤∣S∣|\mathbb{Q}_+| \le |S|∣Q+​∣≤∣S∣：x=p/q→(p,q)x=p/ q \rightarrow (p,q)x=p/q→(p,q)

(2) ∣S∣=∣Z+∣|S| = |\mathbb{Z}_+|∣S∣=∣Z+​∣：沿着对角线取——TBD

(3) ∣Z+∣≤∣Q+∣|\mathbb{Z}_+| \le |\mathbb{Q}_+|∣Z+​∣≤∣Q+​∣：x→x/1x\rightarrow x/1x→x/1

证明：000 到 111 之间的实数集是不可数的。

证明：[0,1][0,1][0,1] 和 (0,1)(0,1)(0,1) 是等势的。

证明：N\mathbb NN 的所有有限子集是可数的。

先直接给出一种数数方法：数集合的二进制表示。

再给出一个证明：

4.3. 康托定理 Cantor's Theorem

Theorem: 康托定理(Cantor's Theorem)

The cardinality of the powerset of an arbitrary set has a greater cardinality than the original arbitrary set.

实际上有：∣P(ℵk)∣=∣ℵk+1∣|\mathcal P(\aleph_k)| = |\aleph_{k+1}|∣P(ℵk​)∣=∣ℵk+1​∣。
